column4: Hello all, I installed ubuntu feisty last night and all was well, untill i tried to get my nvidia drivers running, now i can not get a workable resolution out of x
so anyone here have a working nvidia in ubuntu feisty  ?
and somethings UseEDID "no" in nvidia settings can help
for that matter, pastebin your xorg.conf
pastebin xorg.conf, and pastebin the output of "sudo ddcprobe"
get it running in vesa first?
oh you're in via ssh?  but what monitor is physically on that computer?
hmm.  so can you ever get any X to display?  "sudo dpkg-reconfigure -phigh xserver-xorg" ?
so again X doesnt run at any res at all whatsoever?
have you tried hooking it up directly ( - the matrox thing)
so sudo apt-get --remove nvidia-glx && sudo apt-get install nvidia-glx-new
